item.title: GPG
item.description: GPG(GnuPrivacyGuard) is an Open Source implementation of PGP(PrettyGoodPrivacy). It allows you to encrypt/decrypt and sign data communications. Works on most all OS’s, this will be a Linux, and quick Windows walkthrough. Public/Private Keys: You make a Public Key and a Private Key(always keep Private Key safe and do not share with anyone). You give you Public Key out to anyone They use your Public Key to encrypt the message they want to send to you and you decrypt it with your Private Key.

item.title: My_Usb_Encrypton_Process
item.description: This is the process I use to partition and encrypt usb drives. * I have not tested tested it on anything other than usb’s, though a similar process would potentially work. !! Notice !! Running these commands on the wrong drive could Erase All Data on that Drive!! Only Recoverable if You Had a Backup Make sure you know: Device Name(ie: /dev/sdb) Device Size(ie: 15GiB) Reqs:

item.title: Brightxf
item.description: Brightxf !! Run at Own Risk !! No issues have come from my use of these but that doesn’t mean there won’t be I enjoy making/finding the most minimal gui and still be functional as a daily-driver(functional specifically to my needs). I tend to prefer cwm, a simple window manager, and sxhkd, used as a hot-key daemon, and I test my setup on several different laptops of different specs.

item.title: About
item.description: This site is a place for my to try to gather my notes into a coherent posts. In Nov. 2020, I completely switched to Linux, doing a step by step command line installation, having never actually used any Unix-like system before, making myself learn if I wanted to use my computer. Going down this path of learning all I could of computers and operating systems drastically increased my interest in the Cyber Security field.
